required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of the Impact of Thoracic Outlet Syndromes on the Performance at Work
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of the Impact of Thoracic Outlet Syndromes on the Performance at Work

brief_summary.textblock: Thoracic outlet syndrome may associate neurologic, arterial and venous symptoms. The responsibility of repetitive movements and postural factors has been mentioned for long. Some tasks are hard to perform, and it seemed interesting to assess the consequences of this syndrome on the work capacity by a questionnaire, at the moment of diagnosis by Echo-Doppler

clinical_study.why_stopped: due to Covid19 pandemic , the inclusions slow down , and the rate of occupational problems exceeding by more than 300% changing the objective and the size of the study

primary_outcome.measure: Frequency of an impairment at work

arm_group.arm_group_label: Patients with suspicion of thoracic outlet syndrome

intervention.description: Assessment of the impairment at work by a specific auto- questionnaire given after echo-Doppler that confirm the diagnosis
intervention.arm_group_label: Patients with suspicion of thoracic outlet syndrome

study_pop.textblock: Patients sent to the University Hospital radiology department or to an angiologist with private practice for a suspicion of thoracic outlet syndrome, with diagnosis confirmed by Echo-Doppler

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- A stenosis of at least 80% of arterial stenosis at Echo-Doppler examination during abduction-retropulsion of the arm
- Actually employed or having been employed
Exclusion Criteria:
- Cognitive or mental impairment
- Illiteracy
- Visual impairment
- Patients having been diagnosed with fibromyalgia, chronic fatigue syndrome or ehler-Danlos syndrome
